titleStmt.title: A most excellent and famous ditty of Sampson iudge of Israel how hee wedded Philistines daughter, who at length forsooke him: also how hee slew a lyon, and propounded a riddle, and after how hee was falsely betrayed by Dalila, and of his death. To the tune of the Spanish pauin.

A most excellent and famous ditty of Sampson iudge of Israel how hee wedded Philistines daughter, who at length forsooke him: also how hee slew a lyon, and propounded a riddle, and after how hee was falsely betrayed by Dalila, and of his death. To the tune of the Spanish pauin.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the assignes of Thomas Symcocke,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "VVhen Sampson was a tall yong man".
Place of publication from STC, which has publication date 1628-1629.
Another edition of STC 21688.5, published ca. 1625 with title: A most excellent and famous ditty of Sampson judge of Israell.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
With: The wofull lamentation of Edward Smith. [London] : Printed by the assignes of Thomas Symcocke, [1628 or 9].
